page.title: 03LAND OWNERSHIP CROPS & STOCK
page.content: {Land Ownership.} In the East the Church Commisioners have a large holding, parts of four tenanted farms lying within this area. They are on the best soil and vary from 140 to 285 hectares. Two substantial farms are owned by the occupiers, both are old established farming families. The County Council owns tenanted farms alongside the West end of the A259 road. The sizes of these are from 20 to 60 hectares each. {Crops.} The following crops were grown this year (1985): wheat, barley, a few oats, peas for seed, oil seed rape, potatoes and grass. {Stock.} Three large dairy herds and one beef enterprise.
